originalTitle: My children were recruited in a trafficking scam. I joined a police hunt to find them
title: My children were recruited in a trafficking scam. I joined a police hunt to find them
content: BBC Africa Eye joins an anti-trafficking police unit in Sierra Leone helping a man look for his missing children.

originalTitle: Ecstasy and now a day off - Senegal fans around the world celebrate Afcon win
title: Yay! Senegal Wins the BIG Football Cup!
content:
Hello, my super cool friends! It's your kid-friendly news reporter here, bringing you some VERY exciting news from our amazing continent, Africa! Get ready to cheer because something wonderful has happened!

A HUGE Win for Senegal!

Imagine your favorite team playing a super important game. Now, imagine they WIN! That's what happened for Senegal! Their football team, full of super talented players, played in a very big competition called the Africa Cup of Nations. And guess what? They won! They are the champions of Africa in football! People everywhere are so, so happy! They are dancing, singing, and having the biggest party ever! It's like a birthday party for the whole country, but even bigger!

What is the Africa Cup of Nations?

Let's talk about this big football cup. It's called the Africa Cup of Nations, or AFCON for short. It's like the biggest football party for all the countries in Africa. Teams from different African countries play against each other to see who is the best. **Did you know?** The AFCON trophy is a really shiny, special cup that the winning team gets to lift high in the air! It's a symbol of being the best football team in Africa! It happens every two years, and all the teams try their very best to win. It's a big deal, and everyone watches the games on TV or listens on the radio. Families gather together, cheering for their favorite teams.

The Big Final Game!

Senegal played in the final game against another very strong team, Egypt. It was a super exciting match! Both teams tried very hard, running, kicking, and trying to score goals. The score was 0-0 for a long, long time, which means no one had scored yet! It was very tense, like waiting for a surprise. Because no one scored, they had to do something special called a 'penalty shootout'. This is where players take turns kicking the ball at the goal, with only the goalkeeper trying to stop it. It's very tricky and needs lots of skill! **Did you know?** In a penalty shootout, the ball goes super fast! Sometimes it's like a rocket flying towards the goal! Senegal's players were very brave and good at kicking. They scored more penalties than Egypt, and that's how they won! Hooray!

Meet Our Heroes: The Lions of Teranga!

Senegal's football team has a cool nickname: 'The Lions of Teranga'. Lions are strong and brave, just like their players! 'Teranga' means hospitality and welcome in Senegal, so they are strong and friendly lions! One of their most famous players is called Sadio Mané. He is super-duper good at football! He helped his team a lot. And their coach, the person who tells them what to do, is called Aliou Cissé. He used to be a player for Senegal too! He helped them become champions. **Did you know?** Many of the players on the Senegal team started playing football when they were very small, just like some of you might be doing now!

Dancing in the Streets!

When Senegal won, oh my goodness, the celebrations started! In Senegal, people came out into the streets. They were singing and dancing. They played drums and blew horns. Everyone was hugging and high-fiving! It was like a giant, happy, musical parade that went on all night long! People wore their team's jerseys, which are special shirts with the team's colors. They waved flags of Senegal. Even people living in other countries, who are from Senegal, celebrated with big parties! **Did you know?** Music and dance are a very important part of celebrations in many African countries, making happy moments even more joyful!

A Special Day Off for Everyone!

Because the win was so important and made everyone so happy, the President of Senegal gave everyone a special holiday! That means grown-ups didn't have to go to work, and children didn't have to go to school on that day. They got to stay home and keep celebrating! Imagine that! A special holiday just for a football win! It shows how much this victory meant to the people of Senegal. They had more time to dance, sing, and enjoy being the champions of Africa. **Did you know?** Giving a special holiday is one way for a country to show how proud and happy it is about a big achievement!

Why This Win is So Important

This win is not just about football. It makes everyone in Senegal feel super proud! It shows that if you work hard, never give up, and believe in yourselves, you can achieve great things. It inspires young boys and girls to dream big. Maybe one day, some of you will play football for your country, or become a doctor, or a teacher, or anything you want to be! This win shows that with teamwork and determination, anything is possible. **Did you know?** This is the very first time Senegal has ever won the Africa Cup of Nations! That makes this victory extra special and historic!

Teamwork Makes the Dream Work!

The Senegal team showed us that teamwork is super important. Every player helped each other. They passed the ball, they defended, and they cheered each other on. No one person can win alone; it takes everyone working together like a big family. So, let's all say a big 'WELL DONE!' to Senegal. They are the champions, and they make all of Africa proud. Keep shining, Lions of Teranga! That's all for now from your happy news reporter. See you next time for more amazing stories from our continent!

originalTitle: 'Shameful' and 'terrible look' - the chaos that marred Senegal's triumph
title: 'Shameful' and 'terrible look' - the chaos that marred Senegal's triumph
content: Senegal beat Morocco to win the Africa Cup of Nations after the final is overshadowed when they temporarily refuse to play.

originalTitle: High-speed train crash in Spain kills at least 39
title: High-speed train crash in Spain kills at least 39
content: More than 400 passengers were on board the trains that derailed near the city of Córdoba, in Spain's worst rail crash in more than a decade.

originalTitle: What we know about Spain's worst rail disaster in over a decade
title: What we know about Spain's worst rail disaster in over a decade
content: At least 39 people have died in what local officials are calling Spain's worst rail crash in more than a decade.

title: 'Arsenal will never forgive themselves if they don't win title now'
content: This is Mikel Arteta and Arsenal's "now or never" moment as Premier League title rivals stumble badly, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

title: Diaz will 'have nightmares' over 'Panenka' failure
content: Brahim Diaz had the chance to win Afcon for Morocco, but his choice to try a Panenka ended up costing his side dearly as Senegal hit back to win the game in extra time.
